SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.novell.ldapchai
Interface ChaiUser

All Superinterfaces:
ChaiEntry
public interface ChaiUser
extends ChaiEntry

Represents an ldap user entry.

This interface should be the primary means by which the LDAP Chai API is used to interact with ldap user entries.

Instances of ChaiUser can be obtained by using ChaiFactory.

Author:
Jason D. Rivard

Method Detail

addGroupMembership

void addGroupMembership(ChaiGroup theGroup)
                        throws ChaiOperationException,
                               ChaiUnavailableException
Make this user a member of the specified group. This method takes care of all four attribute assignments used in eDirectory static groups.

Parameters:
theGroup - The group to assign the user to.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
See Also:
ChaiGroup.addMember(ChaiUser)

changePassword

void changePassword(String oldPassword,
                    String newPassword)
                    throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                           ChaiPasswordPolicyException,
                           ChaiOperationException
Changes this ChaiUser's password. This uses the normal change password method in ldap (remove the old, add the new). If the old password is not correct, or the new password does not meet the server's requirements, a ChaiOperationException exception will be thrown.

This method should only be used when the user is the one changing his or her *own* password. For admin password changes, use setPassword(String).

This method does not directly set the users password expiration time attribute, but the ldap directory will typically future date the expiration time during the change operation.

It would be prudent to check the password first using the testPasswordPolicy(String) method before attempting the password set.

Parameters:
oldPassword - Old password value, must be correct or the ldap directory will prohibt the change
newPassword - A new password value that conforms to the users password policy
Throws:
ChaiPasswordPolicyException - If the new password does not meet the user's password policy
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
ChaiOperationException
See Also:
setPassword(String)

expirePassword

void expirePassword()
                    throws ChaiOperationException,
                           ChaiUnavailableException
Mark the user's password as being expired.

Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

getAssistant

ChaiUser getAssistant()
                      throws ChaiOperationException,
                             ChaiUnavailableException
Convenience method to find the this ChaiUser's assistant. Evaluates the ATTR_ASSISTANT attribute and returns the equivalent ChaiUser.

Returns:
a ChaiUser instance referencing the assistant of the user or null if there is no assistant
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

getDirectReports

Set<ChaiUser> getDirectReports()
                               throws ChaiOperationException,
                                      ChaiUnavailableException
Convenience method to find this ChaiUser's direct reports. Evaluates the ATTR_DIRECT_REPORTS attribute and returns the equivalent ChaiUser.

Returns:
A collection of ChaiUser instances that represent this ChaiUsers's direct reports. If this ChaiUser does not have any direct reports, then an empty collection is retured.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

getGroups

Set<ChaiGroup> getGroups()
                         throws ChaiOperationException,
                                ChaiUnavailableException
Convenience method to find this ChaiUser's group memberships. Evaluates the ATTR_GROUP_MEMBERSHIP attribute and returns the equivalent ChaiGroups.

Returns:
A collection of ChaiGroup instances that represent this ChaiUsers's direct reports. If this ChaiUser does not have any group memberships, then an empty collection is retured.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

getManager

ChaiUser getManager()
                    throws ChaiOperationException,
                           ChaiUnavailableException
Convenience method to find this ChaiUser's manager. Evaluates the ATTR_MANAGER attribute and returns the equivalent ChaiUser.

Returns:
a ChaiUser instance referencing the manager of the user or null if there is no manager
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

getPasswordPolicy

ChaiPasswordPolicy getPasswordPolicy()
                                     throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                                            ChaiOperationException
Retreive this ChaiUser's password policy. The implementation evaluates both Universal Password policies as well as legacy policy settings to determine the password policy.

Returns:
a valid password policy for the user.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

Returns:
true if the password is expired
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation

readPassword

String readPassword()
                    throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                           ChaiOperationException
Retrieve the user's current password. This method is likely to fail if a variety of conditions are not met:
  1. The connection to the server is SSL
  2. The ChaiProvider's ChaiSetting.EDIRECTORY_ENABLE_NMAS is set to true.
  3. The user entry's assigned password policy supports user or admin retrieval of passwords
  4. The connection has rights to retrieve the password

Returns:
the users password
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - If the configuration of the provider is not suitable for retrieving passwords.
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

readPasswordExpirationDate

Date readPasswordExpirationDate()
                                throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                                       ChaiOperationException
Read the user's password expiration date. The implementation will attempt to read the user's defined or calculated password date.

    Returns:
    the date at which the password is expired, or the current time if the password is expired but a date cannot be determined
    Throws:
    UnsupportedOperationException - If the configuration of the provider is not suitable for retreiving passwords.
    ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
    ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

void removeGroupMembership(ChaiGroup theGroup)
                           throws ChaiOperationException,
                                  ChaiUnavailableException
Remove this ChaiUser from the specified group. This method takes care of all four attribute assignments used in eDirectory static groups.

Parameters:
theGroup - The group to assign the user to.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
See Also:
ChaiGroup.removeMember(ChaiUser)

setPassword

void setPassword(String newPassword)
                 throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                        ChaiPasswordPolicyException,
                        ChaiOperationException
Sets this ChaiUser's password. This uses the normal administrative set password method in ldap. If the old password is not correct, or the new password does not meet the server's requirements, a discriptive exception will be thrown.

This method should only be used for administators setting a different user's password. For self changes, use changePassword(String,String).

This method does not directly set the users password expiration time attribute, but the ldap directory will typically mark the current date as the password expiration time during the set operation, causing the password to be expired (and changed) for the user during the next authentication.

It would be prudent to check the password first using the testPasswordPolicy(String) method before attempting the password set.

Parameters:
newPassword - A new password value that conforms to the users password policy
Throws:
ChaiPasswordPolicyException - If the new password does not meet the user's password policy
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error while setting the password
See Also:
changePassword(String,String)

testPassword

boolean testPassword(String passwordValue)
                     throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                            ChaiPasswordPolicyException
Test a users value for this ChaiUser's password. Appropriate rights are required for this to work properly. This call generally only tests the password value itself, and not any other authentication meta attributes such as account disabled, or other authentication restrictions.

Thus, a succcessfull test does not neccessarily mean that an authentication (BIND) would work with this password.

Implementation Note: Calling this method is essentially the same as calling ChaiEntry.compareStringAttribute(String USER_PASSWORD, String value) and converting ChaiOperationalException to ChaiPasswordPolicyException.

Parameters:
passwordValue - A new password to be tested against the ldap directory
Returns:
true if password is correct.
Throws:
ChaiPasswordPolicyException - If the password does not meet the user's password policy
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
See Also:
changePassword(String,String), setPassword(String)

testPasswordPolicy

boolean testPasswordPolicy(String testPassword)
                           throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                                  ChaiPasswordPolicyException
Test a new value for this ChaiUser's password. This method does not cause a change or set to actually occur. This is useful before calling the setPassword(String) or changePassword(String, String) methods.

Parameters:
testPassword - A new password value that conforms to the users password policy
Returns:
true if password meets the user's policy. Never returns false (returns ChaiPasswordPolicyException instead)
Throws:
ChaiPasswordPolicyException - If the password does not meet the user's password policy
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
See Also:
changePassword(String,String), setPassword(String)

isAccountEnabled

boolean isAccountEnabled()
                         throws ChaiOperationException,
                                ChaiUnavailableException
Throws:
ChaiOperationException
ChaiUnavailableException

unlock

void unlock()
            throws ChaiOperationException,
                   ChaiUnavailableException
Unlocks a user from many conditions that would prevent the user from logging in. Primarily, intruder detection triggers will be unlocked on the user.

Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

isLocked

boolean isLocked()
                 throws ChaiOperationException,
                        ChaiUnavailableException
Checks if a user account is locked. Primarily, this checks for states similar to intruder detection or account lock due to incorrect login attempts.

Returns:
true if the account is in a locked state
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable

readPasswordModificationDate

Date readPasswordModificationDate()
                                  throws ChaiOperationException,
                                         ChaiUnavailableException
Attempts to read the modification timestamp of the user's password. Depending on the ChaiProvider.DIRECTORY_VENDOR, the implementation may or may not be able to reliably read this value.

Returns:
Date of the user's last password modification time, or null if unable to read.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If there is an error during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
